title: Is it okay to say 'She is in black and white' or 'She is wearing black and white', supposing that she is waering a black Tshirt and white jeans? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is it okay to say "She is in black and white" or "She is wearing black and white", supposing that she is waering a black Tshirt and white jeans? Yes, you can use either of those expressions in that situation. In fact, I said pretty much the same thing to my neighbour when we spoke (at a virally safe distance!) across our garden fences yesterday. Noticing we were both wearing blue jeans, black t-shirts and black shoes, I exclaimed, “Oh look, we’re both in black and blue!”
